abstract: TechShop, a chain of do-it-yourself workshops, is a corporate version of the “hacker spaces” that have risen in popularity over the last couple of years to cater to people who like to hack things open and see how they work, The New York Times writes.

lead_paragraph: Mark Hatch sees the revolution going something like this:
